Thin a matrix by a minimum pairwise distance

Source: R/ThinByMin.R
ThinByMin.Rd

Greedily select labels so that all pairwise distances among the kept labels are >= min_dist

Usage

ThinByMin(D, min_dist, seed = 1)

Arguments

D

A square distance matrix (numeric) with identical row/column names.

min_dist

Numeric scalar: minimum allowed pairwise distance.

seed

Integer for reproducibility (passed to set.seed).

Value

A symmetric numeric matrix: the thinned distance matrix restricted to the kept labels (rows/columns in the order they were added).

Author

Anika Mittal

Examples

D <- matrix(c(
  0, 3, 8, 6,
  3, 0, 7, 4,
  8, 7, 0, 5,
  6, 4, 5, 0
), nrow = 4, byrow = TRUE,
dimnames = list(LETTERS[1:4], LETTERS[1:4]))
thin_by_min_distance_matrix(D, min_dist = 6)
#> Error in thin_by_min_distance_matrix(D, min_dist = 6): could not find function "thin_by_min_distance_matrix"
